relatedGenes.name: major histocompatibility complex, class I, B

summaryMarkdown.html: Monitor for liver function and select an alternative drug instead of flucloxacillin if liver enzymes or bilirubin is elevated, for patients that are HLA-B*57:01.

textMarkdown.html:
Read more about how PharmGKB curates DPWG guidelines using extra information provided by DPWG to enable the interactive genotype tool above.

November 2018 Guideline

The Royal Dutch Pharmacists Association - Pharmacogenetics Working Group has evaluated therapeutic dose recommendations for flucloxacillin and HLA-B*57:01.

Wording in table taken from the Dutch guidelines November 2018 update

ALLELE/GENOTYPE/PHENOTYPE DRUG DESCRIPTION RECOMMENDATION
HLA-B*5701 flucloxacillin HLA-B*5701-positive patients have an 80-fold elevated risk of flucloxacillin-induced liver injury. However, the incidence is low (1-2 per 1000 individuals). 1. Regularly monitor the patientâ€™s liver function
2. Choose an alternative if liver enzymes and/or bilirubin levels are elevated

Read for more information about this recommendation, Read about gene information from DPWG

Preemptive genotyping

Excerpts from the DPWG risk analysis document for flucloxacillin and HLA-B:

The KNMP Pharmacogenetics Working Group considers genotyping before starting flucloxacillin to be beneficial for drug safety. It is advised to consider genotyping these patients before (or directly after) drug therapy has been initiated to guide drug selection.

Read more about how DPWG assigns their recommendations for preemptive genotyping.
